newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican army, police search for rebels.
newsitem.headline: Mexican army, police search for rebels.

text.p: Mexican army and police launched an intensive search in the mountains in the state of Guerrero on Tuesday for a group of hooded, armed men believed to be members of a guerrilla group, the government said.
Television news reports showed army helicopters firing into heavily wooded areas in the search for the presumed guerrillas.
The Interior Ministry said in a report that a taxi driver saw 10 hooded, armed men crossing a highway, which sparked the widespread search by the army and police.
The hooded men were believed to belong to the Popular Revolutionary Army (EPR), whose attacks killed at least 15 people in several states last week.
The Interior Ministry said that by nightfall all it had found were two hoods and a pair of military boots.
Thousands of troops and federal police have already been drafted into rural states such as Guerrero and Oaxaca where the EPR struck.
A senior government source said on Tuesday that the rebel group would be hard to defeat because of their high mobility,
Police also remained on alert in the capital, Mexico City.
In the state of Oaxaca, the state government presented three men who it says had ties to the rebel group.
State-run news agency Notimex quoted a federal Interior Ministry statement that four presumed members of the EPR were being held in the state of Oaxaca.
